item.description:
"Samba Tremeterra" translated into English would mean something like "earth-shaking samba".
Samba Tremeterra is an Afro-Brazilian music and dance group, and their shows are really fun and high energy with a carnival feel. I hope that some of you will come and help us shake the earth.

This event is more intended for the enjoyment of a cultural event than practicing the Portuguese language since this event will take place at a bar/club.

People are welcome and encouraged to practice their Portuguese, however I just wanted to warn you that this event may frustrate people whose main intention is to practice Portuguese. This is not a formal Portuguese language practicing session, regardless there will be a lot of Portuguese speakers available and it will be a lot of fun. I recommend to those who really want to practice Portuguese to arrive on-time so to take advantage of the quieter portion of the night.

To learn more about Samba TremeTerra visit the following web sites:

http://www.facebook.c...
http://www.rylesjazz....
http://www.capoeira-a...
*******************************

Also, do not forget, there is a $10 cover charge.


********************************

Also, I would not mind if someone would like to help me being hosting this activity.
Please let me know if you like to volunteer as being a point person for this event, help greet people as they arrive.

Send me an email so we can coordinate efforts.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me or a "Portuguese Meet-Up" sign at one of tables close to the stage.

group.name: The Boston/Cambridge Portuguese Language Meetup Group

item.name: Samba Tremeterra at Ryles
